info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 4:37PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Franklin, Stephens and southeastern Habersham Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Toccoa, or 4 miles east of Mount Airy, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Cornelia, Demorest, Mount Airy, Baldwin, Avalon, Martin, Boydville and Eastanolee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
